name: (C) ESTAR HP TS (Resist. Heat)
_description: ENERGY STAR air source heat pump (w/ cold climates specs as applicable) fully replacing original resistance heating equipment

notes: ENERGY STAR V. 4.0 went into effect in January 2023 as reflected under 2023 column. Ventilation savings are based on ComStock simulations of a variable speed HP RTU with energy recovery
savings are averaged across all states.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

installed_cost_source.notes: ENERGY STAR costs in 2023 normalized by capacity.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

notes: Includes all resistance-based heating in commercial buildings

cooling multiple of 34% was determined by dividing square feet in which cooling equipment is packaged AND heating equipment is electric or none (120416960 sf) by square feet with same cooling constraint and heating across all fuel types (357885079 sf). Ventilation multiples determined by square feet in which given ventilation system (VAV or CAV) is paired with given heating system for the measure.
